reviews.review_msg: His lecture note is too simple. Final supposes to be three hours, but he arranged it as two hours with double sized of mid-term questions. He is the teacher not so reponsable.
A good Professor I've never seen.

Doug Allen is an amazing prof. He explains the chapters during each lecture so do not skip them but this is definitly not an easy course... after the midterm, everything is extremely confusing. His midterm and final are also hard. Overall if you do the textbook questions and read the textbook to understand the content you should do fine.
Very interesting class. Midterm was fair. Final was killer and i mean it. Don't take this class unless you really plan on working hard.
He is a good prof, but his exams are very very hard. The class average was even below 50%. Other profs are so much easier, but they don't teach as good as allen :)
Great Prof thus far. REALLY HARD CLASS, but it'll pay off in the long run. His class may be long, but it's always interesting.

Tough exams, but Prof. Choi is helpful and cares about student success. Take good notes, use the free textbook, and try Unstuck AI for extra practice - it really helped me prep for the challenging quizzes.
Come to class and do your quizzes. Exams are so easy.  All the multiple choice questions are 100% copies and pasted from quizzes.
Took him for Econ 103 and 105. Not sure why people are saying he's a tough marker, when his test questions are all from his lecture notes. Go to class and pay attention, then you will do really well!

Jun's exams are tough as hell, ECON105 is not as hard as it looks like when you see his question paper. Except that, he is a good professor. He teaches good, he is caring, his grading system is also perfect and overall he is the teacher you should pick if you are ready to face his exams and quizzes offline

Jun is super nice and very willing to help and wants you to do well. He says first lecture if you have a problem with his accent then get a different prof, I got used to his accent very quickly and enjoyed the class although it was definitely a tough class
The lectures are nice and you get to understand everything until you get to the exams. This exams are difficult and if you want to pass the course, you should study every week.
Great prof, hard test, he prepares lecture note and lots of practice material for you. Great lecture. Just be sure to study and you will be fine.
Test hard, and no formula was given.

His lectures might be difficult to follow sometimes but the hardest thing was probably the tests. Unlike other teachers, his tests will be closed note; therefore, you have to remember all the formulas on your own, if you never study econ before college, I would recommend you to look for another.

I took Juns course and he is my best professor this term by far. Hes funny, engaging and explains concepts using real life examples that are easy to understand. Although the quizzes are difficult if you pay attention and do the practice work you can definitely get a good grade. He tries to give as much information as possible to do well.

Well, i see lots of nonsense reviews. No doubt that he is a tough grader, he actually fails more than 50% of the class. His accent is so thick which makes it even harder for someone who is a native english speaker to understand the course. OVERALL, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND HIM AT ALL!

I'm so happy I got to be in his class, his lectures might be long but the way he explains makes everything so much easy-going. He is a tough grader, and his exams are hard; you have to pay attention and take notes if you don't understand something, he's great in office hours and will answer any question, I'm taking his class for Econ103.
Terrible terrible prof. Thick accent, horrible lectures. Always late for class by at least 5 min. Just dont ever take his class, NOT WORTHY AT ALL!!
best prof ever bye <3
He is an amazing and hilarious instructor. He knows he has strong accent so he teaches slowly and easily to understand. He gave us good examples and very helpful in the office hours. highly recommend
I really dont understand why his exams are so hard, actually for my previous class more than 70% of the students failed his course.
I really dont recommend him. His exams are so hard and the final is mind blowing also he has a thick accent which makes it more difficult...

Jun was an amazing prof last semester!!! No textbook is needed as Jun explains the course very well in his notes. Jun uses real life examples to explain economic concepts. Really good prof although you really need to study for midterms and final exam. He gives a quiz every week which you need to study for as well!

Jun was the best prof I've ever had at SFU. I took both econ103 and econ105 with him. He was extremely understanding and would condense the textbook into his own personal notes so purchasing a textbook is not needed.
Do the practice quizzes. Follow his lectures. Study his notes not the book. Quizzes and midterms are challenging so go prepared.

Jun's second midterm is really difficult but his first midterm and final are fair - just make sure you go over all MCQs every week and pay attention in class. His lectures are funny and straightforward. He does have a heavy accent but it's not a huge problem because he speaks slowly.

Tough class but Jun was very willing to help and always encourages questions, even over email. He posts lecture notes online, however, there are blanks to fill in that you must attend the lecture for - or have a friend who can send you pictures as he doesn't post the filled out ones online!

Jun is a very nice person. He provides good notes but the exams are extremely difficult. This is an extremely tough class due to the heavy emphasis on exams and the notes and class content not preparing you for this. The accent is not that big of a deal but it does impact the flow of the lecture. Get a tutor and best of luck!
His concepts and knowledge is good however his thick accent makes it difficult to understand throughout the lecture

His lectures are very straight forward, as he prepared all the lecture notes. No surprises on quizes and exams, and gives lots of examples and analogies to help students understand. Definitely would take again.

Jun was one of my favorite lower division professors. Do all of the homework and practice midterms/finals and you will do very well in the course.  All ECON courses are hard. Do not expect to get off easy in this course.  Very funny lectures, and a great guy in person. 100% recommend taking 105 with him.

This course was very tough for a 100 level course. Jun seems to know the material quite well, but he grades very strictly, and be aware his tests are killer, you have to use the right words and have to match the economic principles, the way he taught it in lectures, in addition textbook wasnt too helpful neither were his TA's. Avoid at all costs...

Jun is a really underrated professor in my opinion. Sure, he has a pretty thick accent, but he provides really comprehensive fill-in-the-blank notes which make note-taking in lectures very easy, and he's consistently funny--always trying to lighten up a pretty dry subject. He made macroeconomics consistently fun, and his tests are fair. Good prof!

Although Jun is hard to understand sometimes, he is actually a passionate teacher. He explains the concepts in details. I remember his joke he told us in class and he tries to make the class interesting. His example is also easy to understand and related to topics. Recommend to those who are studying economics for the first time.

His lecture notes were really helpful and easy to understand. I made flashcards based off his lecture notes and basically memorized everything but the midterm and final was still kind of difficult. Make sure you read the questions carefully for the open book quizzes in tutorial and do the practice MCs and homework questions !

Good lecturer (but has heavy accent). I found his lecture notes really helpful. Manageable exams but he's very strict on checking it, so I don't think the exam results strongly reflected what I learn in his class.
hard exams and midterms

Jun does not follow the textbook at all, midterms and final exams are based off of lecture notes which he goes through throughly during lecture. Open book tutorial quizzes I found were very difficult. Both midterms were very hard, however I found the final exam contrastingly different and very easy. He also has an heavy accent.
Jun is really sick! this guy had really hard questions on exam.
Passionate in teaching, it is him that makes me to love economics
the best professor i have ever met in sfu, he makes me to love economics

Jun is funny, but his tests are very tough. Averages on the second midterm and final were below 50%. However, his notes are very concise. Do the MCQ's for each chapter and you should be fine on the tests.

Jun was the best econ prof I've had at SFU, his notes are crystal clear and very straight forward, understand those and you'll ace the class. Exams are extremely tough so prepare by doing end of chapter questions and looking over the in class quizzes again. Prepare especially well for the 2nd midterm, a third of the class failed that.

Jun is the best Econ prof I v ever had, his notes are crystal clear, and there isn't much need for a text book.  By attending his lecture and read every lecture notes, it a guaranteed pass. However, it does take time if you want an A. Do all the MCQs(60 per chapter), not only helps MCQs on exam but also understanding. Effort  A in his class.

A professor who really gives the time to respond to emails and help students out.  Hard to understand his lectures sometimes because of his accent.  He gives good study notes and practice questions that help for the tests.

Jun is a very funny, knowledgeable prof. He is always very willing to help and cares about his students. He does have a strong Korean accent so he was sometimes difficult to understand but he enunciates well. Exams were quite difficult.

Hilarious guy, fun to be in his lecture to hear him talk although it requires a lot of focus to catch everything he is saying due to his accent, but nonetheless a great prof. However he gives hard tests. destroyed my self confidence after taking his tests.

He was an awesome teacher, as in he knew the concepts well and gave good examples. He was very difficult to understand-- this definitely made the course tough. He was a funny guy though! Second midterm was reaaal tough, final was more fair. All in all, a pretty decent prof!

Overall, he is a good prof. He's very helpful as he has lots of office hours and responds to every email very quickly. He is hard to understand because of his heavy accent however. The material is very dry but he tries to keep things interesting in lecture through his funny stories. Never used the textbook, his lecture notes cover everything.
Outstanding clarity and extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend to people who do not complain about accents.
hes not bad... Repeats all this exam questions. Find someone with previous exam papers and you shall get an A

Great prof! The course material could be perceived as quite boring but Jun uses a mix of class interaction, analogies, and humor to help you relate to the material better. The exams are no cakewalk; however, if you review all your assignments, notes, and do the practice mc questions, they are more than possible to do well on.

Exams are really hard and his accent makes sometimes makes it hard to understand him in lecture. However, he scales and it is easy to beat the average on exams. Midterms and final are based off the tutorial assignments, so study those really well.
Hard to understand but notes are helpful. Exams are okay. Study MCQ, notes and assignments and you'll do fine.

Jun is an amazing prof and funny. He uses examples that students can relate to. His exams seem hard, but they're all based off his notes and things he says in class. I ended up with an A by just reviewing notes. A lot of exams questions are straight from the assignments as well. If you do the assignments and go to class, you will succeed.

He's a pretty good prof, good notes, fair midterm and final. He's a little difficult to understand because of his accent, but if you ready the textbook and compliment it with his notes, you'll understand most of everything.

Great lecturer + fair exams. Definitely try the MCQs-they are not only on the exams (easy 30%!), but are essential tools in understanding the key concepts. Notes are a bit too concise-so pay attention in class, go to tutorial, read the textbook! I found e-mails more helpful than office hours as he was always quick to respond. Overall a great prof!
Great prof ignore all the bad reviews. He is great tests are easy if you study. Take it with him this class was great

Jun is a wonderful guy! He does his best to make the material exciting with jokes and his general interest in his students well-being. Exams are definitely difficult, but he gives you the answers in lecture notes and tutorial assignments. Go to class and ensure you review the notes. Grades are curved so just stay above the average.

Notes are really clear. You really need to understand the concepts, & do the math. Exams are quite straight forward, a little difficult, but easy to get a good mark in (because of the scale). There's a bit of writing, and you need to have a bit of economic background. Study the MCQ sets! Jun is personally very nice, a good prof, easy to talk to.
AVOID unless you want to lower your gpa. Hardest tests class avg was fail for all midterms

His exams are fair and similar to the assignments and notes. Also, it is pretty much impossible to get less than 30% since you are given the answers for the MC are all given to you ahead of time. Overall, he is a great prof and definitely recommend taking 105 with him.
Easy as long as you following with him, exam it decent. Funny and interesting class.
Just too hard test to do, if you can get answer NO.1, you can't get all of rest answer.

He really tries to make economics enjoyable by being humorous. Tricky/Tough midterms/exams but the class is curved which definitely helps. Accent made it hard for me to understand him but notes are fill in the blank so no biggie. Textbook is useless, lecture notes are enough to help you get through midterms/exam. Wouldn't really recommend.

I'm a third year student, and the difficulty of the course is just medium among the courses I've taken so far. To those who complain about the difficulty of the course, you'll see much harder couses than this as you take more courses. According to Maclean's statistics, only 2/3 of students can graduate from SFU within 7 years.

He's really nice, but has really hard and long exams!All exams are conceptual so be prepared to think. You cant go into his exams by simple memorizing stuff, you really have to internalize everything. Class average was always around 40%-55%. Would not recommend him unless he's your last resort to taking econ 105. Good luck!
vary hard exams & assignments. final 16 pages, and every exam expects u to solve the NEW TYPE OF PROBLEM using what you know but most are what you NOT learned in class. AVOID.

37% MT1 avg. 39% MT2/44%Final avg. No one cares if he's a nice teacher/ can teach / is helpful/clear/smart. He teaches you 1+1 in class clearly but so what? He will teach you ABC clearly in lecture but expects u to know ABCDEFGHIJK.  His MT was 16 pages. Highest in class was 75%. After he curves the class avg, it was like 51%. Seriously?

His first midterm was a lot harder than his second one. The final wasn't too bad. It is important that you go in understanding the concepts he starred. He is a very good lecturer and his notes are awesome. His TA's are useless but Jun is very willing to help.
fair grading. course material is boring but Jun does his best to keep everyone awake.

I'm not econ major, but I think this course is not hard, it's just time consuming. The exams were okay, but I agree that the 1st midterm was long and harder than the 2nd midterm.  The math portion on the 1st MT is just algebra, no big deal. You just have to know what you're doing. He has an accent, so you have to listen carefully. The book helps

If the class average for a final exam is 40 after you've been teaching 240 people a subject for an entire semester, thats a pretty clear sign that you should seriously reconsider the way you teach and write your exams. This professor is bad. Avoid.

This professor is very smart and obviously understands the material thoroughly...however, he cannot teach worth a damn. I studied extensively for the final and received an absolutely appalling grade. His exams are extremely difficult and convoluted. Someone needs to remind him hit is a 100 LEVEL COURSE.
Good Prof, But Hard Exams. Study Hard !
Assignments , midterms, and final is brutal. Class average is like 37% on exams and 50% on assignments
He is too hard. He doesnt care about his students. I cannt understand what he is saying. His Exams are too hard. He makes ECON105 more difficult that what it actually is.

Amazing prof.  Has fill in the blank notes, make sure you attend class and understand the concepts. Gives practice Mc of which he chooses some to put on midterms. Very helpful. Work hard because the material is heavy but Jun was amazing and teaching it
Midterm average for his class was 30%. All questions math based and nested. Thick accent.

Jun is a decent prof. This was my first econ class and I found his lectures very clear. His exams were long and difficult but if you put the time into studying you'll do fine. The material is really dry and boring but Jun tries his best to keep you focused throughout the lecture. I would definitely take a class with him again!
exams are too difficult >:(

Jun is a humorous guy and has a heavy Korean accent. He provides organized lecture notes that are useful. The TA is knowledgeable in the material but not so good in English. Jun's exams tend to be hard so be well prepared.
too many mc in exam and too hard
What can I say, I love this guy. Sure he has an accent, but he's so funny and caring! Never a dull moment in Jun's class!

Very helpful and entertaining professor. He has an accent, but never a dull moment in his class. Very fair exam, no surprises. The MCs on exams are taken directly from homework. Midterm weight can be partially shifted to Final. Crystal clear notes, no need to read/use the textbook. Do not hesitate if given a choice guys/gals!

Super helpful and nice! Best prof you could ever have if you utilize his office hours and TAs. Only he would put up office hours everyday of the weekend before an exam to help us out. If you suck at econ or need help, don't hesitate to see him!
Exams are difficult and very long.
He is a really nice one. Although the exam is little bit hard, as long as you work hard you can do well. I love his lecture. He is good!

Accent is a bit heavy, but he has his slides online so you can print it out and fill in the blanks as he goes. Has pop quizzes (just for bonus marks). Textbook is helpful, but you can always go to his office hours if you need more explanation. He's really nice, so don't be scared.
A very good tecacher. His concepts are very clear and he is very helpful too.

Notes are awesome don't need textbook. Tests get harder but are fair. Final was pretty hard. The course is set up that you basically get 15% if you attend all lectures and tutorials. Jun explains things great and makes lectures interesting.
Really good prof,tests get gradually harder
Jun is a nice prof. He keeps in interesting even though it is a dry course. He has good notes, but exams are tough. His exams are leaning on the fair-tough side. Sophie is a great TA!

Jun goes beyond his ability to help me and many other students to get good marks. Also, he is willing to spend extra time to explain econ theories and concepts to his students to underatand better. Not only that, his lectures are very interesting and he makes it funny using lits of examples. I would definitely recommend him for econ classes!!!

this course is a great course for understanding macroeconomics! the professor makes things really easy to understand and tries his best to make his lectures interesting. textbook is not really necessary unless you're trying to get an A.

Econ has always been a very boring topic to me but Jun makes it really interesting. And, for the first time, I feel I finally understand Econ. His exams are not easy but he is very very helpful and is willing to help. Office hours are extremely helpful. His notes are fill in the blanks which makes life a lot more easy in class so you get to listen.

He doesn't give any mandatory homework (except tutorial questions) so that is a plus, except it may dampen your grade because you're not being forced to apply your knowledge. But I do advise you to read the textbook and review his notes to get a better understanding for his exams. His exams require you to understand the material very well!

Jun is a Boss. Wears a/x and drives a balling car. A part from that, everything he tests on is emphasized in class, and his MC are taken from sets which are posted online. Also he'll weigh your MTs less if you do good on the final. For a dry course like macroeconomics Jun teaches it well and ensures you are able to apply it to real life scenarios.

Economics is arguably the hardest 1st year university course but Jun does a good job of clearly explaining it in his accent hehe. Midterms and final include real world applications and are tough but fair. Don't worry about averages as the class will be scaled to your favour. The MC sets are extremely helpful, and love the fill in the blank notes :)

Jun is a nice and funny guy. Pretty strong accent. Really willing to help. Structure of exams is predictable after the first midterm, and exams were largely fair, but not always perfectly understandable. Recommend if you don't understand his lecture notes, read the textbook, it makes more sense than how he chooses to word it. Is a tougher course.

He's a nice guy but he needs to do a better job of getting the class to stop talking!!! His tests are relevant to his notes but are definitely more challenging than the examples :P Overall, he is a good prof and I hope i get an A-!!! I screwed up some questions on the final but maybe the scaling will help

I really do not understand why the easiness scale for Jun is so high. His exams get progressively harder. The first midterm was fair, the second midterm was substantially harder relative to the first one, and the final was just a killer. MT 1 average was 62% and MT 2 average was 56%. I can only presume the average for the final will be worse.

Jun's a funny guy, the accent often gets in the way though. Great notes but his midterms cover EVERYTHING. Final was alright but he has questions about every big concept. Scales and has a "salvation scheme" Overall a nice good prof but you will have difficulties understanding him at times.
The course material is so dry but he's hot so his looks makes up for it. His accent can be hard to understand sometimes but who cares, he's hoooooot! ;)
He knows what he's talking about. If you're interested in the subject, it's not painful.  Personally, to me, the course is dry. But good prof. He uses entertaining examples.

I see that some people have commented on how he's boring. Keep in mind that it IS economics and he makes it as interesting as possible. Tests are completely fair. He prepares you for them very well. If you do put in the time to study, you'll do great on the exam. Overall, excellent prof.
Nice and outgoing teacher. Granted his accents is factor to understanding some material. Overall hes a good professor and  is willing to help you understand the material he teaches.

Jun is a nice guy but he makes for a very bad teacher. Yes his English could use some work, and his lectures are monotone but that isn't really a big issue. The problem is that all he teaches is numbers and formulas, no theory. As a student you can't grasp the concept behind the equation because he is unable to articulate. His tests are hard.
He's very boring. needs to improve English.
he's good ;]]

True, his exams are fair, and he does crack a joke here and there, but i just found his lectures so, SO boring. Very nice guy, but in courses like intro to micro or macro, it could be so easy and beneficial to bring examples from current events and interpret them. Too bad he thinks so inside the box, because he has potential.
Very good prof
THE EXAMS ARE QUITE LONG BUT THEY ARE NOT THAT HARD. YOU MAY GET GRADE 'A' IF YOU STUDY A BIT.
His MT and Finals are way to long and all the questions are nested, so if you don't now how to start it, you screwed

Basil seems like a cool guy but his lectures are hard to follow. If you intend on showing up to class sit close because he doesnt even speaks into his microphone. The textbook is very good and will be your best friend. TA is also very helpful but attendance was not mandatory. Exam included questions that were on none of the practice material or hw.

Professor Vasyl runs a relaxed yet engaging class. Tests are manageable with minimal studying. Showed his reviews and just laughed - what a legend! unstuckstudy was a great study aid alongside the textbook.
If satan or vasyl was teaching this class, take it with satan cuz tbh this class is literal hell

This guy is soooo old school. His lectures are done with a projector using a piece of paper and a pen. None of his notes make sense and you can barely understand what he says with his accent. Dont bother going to lectures. He doesnt post anything from lectures but you can learn everything from the textbook. Its a big snooze fest.

Horrible and unorganized lectures. All of your learning will come from the textbook. Picking up anything from lectures is extremely difficult. The way he teaches is incomprehensible, outdated, and confusing. Avoid his class at all costs.

Basil at first was really hard to understand and since I was a first year student, his lecture style intimidated me at first. After taking the first midterm however, his class became a lot easier since his tests are straight forward and relate to the material from the practice exams. TAs honestly make or break this class, get ready to read a lot.
I showed this man his reviews and he started laughing. GOAT.
the GOAT, this man is so relaxed and make learning economics worthwhile and interesting. Tests were also really chill and easy - minimal studying is required to get a decent grade.
No he did not in fact concoct a final from hell.
King Basil
Not organized
Great professor who is enthusiastic about the material. He explains concepts well and makes lectures interesting. Uses relatable real life examples well to illustrate course ideas.

Professor Vasyl or Basyl was the worst prof I've had at SFU. He is an irresponsible professor who gives a rats ass about the students. Clearly he is busy with other priorities and doesn't seem like he is interested in being a professor. He is supper unaccessible to the students, will not reply emails! He does not communicate well about anything.
Interesting prof, well accomplished. Doesn't reply to emails much though

He's a cool guy, but you must read the textbook. His lectures never made much sense. His midterms were terrible, not enough time is given to effectively read and answer questions. Had him in person couple years ago, was a lot better then. Plus easier tests in person. SFU also criticized him for being "too easy" so now, he is becoming more difficult

Nice guy, but online environment does not work with him, he doesnt respond . Also, questions are way harder than textbook questions, youll get a pass if you know the basics, but quantitive is calc you wont see in the textbook. He doesnt give textbook solutions either

Cool guy but lectures dont rlly help and is just him rambling, rather have slides. reading txtbk is a must. Midterms rather difficult but final was fine. make sure to review assignments and txtbk qs to not get 0 for calc questions. main issue for me was we were graded on a few things in comparison to Dumans 103. Midterm /20 marks for 15 ercent ;-;
Vasyl seems to be knowledgeable, but his lectures are unorganized with frequent sidetracking. Would not recommend (unless you want to teach yourself the entire course).

Golovetskyy is a very interesting professor. His lectures can be a bit incoherent and hard to follow at times, though he really does work to help you understand the concepts. Reading the textbook is a must, but if you do, the class is VERY straightforward.

Vasyl is a pretty reasonable prof. He's a really cool guy, but he can get derailed sometimes during lectures. As long as you do well on the weekly assignments and quizzes, you'll do fine. Grading scheme is set up so that these marks can offset the importance of big exams, which was really nice to have in a relatively rigorous first year course.

Vasyl seems to be an interesting person, but the delivery of course content is severely lacking. Inaccessibility, lectures of little substance, and unusually difficult exams come together to create a poor experience overall. I cannot recommend taking this course with this professor.

I am serious about my studies I had bad profs. I took his class last semester. I think it was my worst experience with a prof at SFU. The course concept is fairly simple, but the teaching provided is terrible. There is no point in attending the lectures, pure waste of time nothing beneficial. Exams are way too hard for 100 level introductory course

the course itself is easy, concepts are not too hard. however, my rating is solely of the prof, not the course. i would go lower than one but there isn't an option for that. he definitely does not care about his quality of teaching or his students. would not recommend. actually, i would recommend staying away from this prof

His assignments and quizzes are pretty easy, but it's the midterm and the final that drag down your grade a lot. However, his teaching style + lectures are terrible and he puts no effort into helping students. I sent him an email question right after the midterm, and he replied after the final. He also does not round, even 0.01%. Overall, bad prof!

Ok, I just barely passed this course, so maybe some other people's experiences might be different. Also, this was online. I don't recommend this route. Prof is a very nice guy. Highly accomplished. He cares, I think, but he doesn't reply to emails very often. Very hard midterm. The final was not that bad. TA doesn't do much in this course/useless.

Basil is a good prof. His quizzes can be quite difficult but are made up of hw questions and are often word for word the same. One criticism is that he is often ambiguous with his questions on assignments so you will need to make and then state assumptions.

I am currently taking his class online and he is definitely the worst prof I have ever had. He gradually became worse over the semester. He started forgetting to post the lectures and would post the assignments 2 days before they're due when he said he'd post it a week before. Also, he has given us 0 info about the final and it's in a few days.
Sooo freakin' funny... I guess some find his accent a bit unclear, but all I can say is deal with it! Econ is difficult, so maybe that's why some people didn't do well, cause Golov is awesome.

bad prof,mumble a lot, you have to sit in the first 3 rolls to actually learn stuff.exams are not easy. there ARE needs to come to the lecture, but...just boring. not professional teaching.So...you will think its a relaxing class until you see your final grade!
Great texbook, helpful TA, fair exams and BAD PROFESSOR!!!!

I took his macro class in fall 2008. There's absolutely NO POINT in going to his classes. You can't understand anything he says, especially when he just takes words straight from the textbook. The textbook was clear, reader-friendly, and does a much better job explaining than he does. But i have to admit, his class and exams were quite easy.

Course content was straight from the textbook, plus the text he uses is very easy to read and understand. Just don't expect help from him cause my TA explains better than him although I never went to lecture and rarely went to tutorials. Midterms and Finals was fairly straightfoward if u read the text. Take him for a GPA boost.
Prof is very boring. Sumtimes hard to understand. Does not email notes out. Overall, I did not like him.

One of the worst profs ever! Went to the first couple of classes but stopped going altogether after a while. All he does is summarize the book, but does that poorly as well. I asked him a question once and he managed to talk for a long time without answering it. If you do take this course with him just read the book on your own.

Course content was quite easy. He basically summarizes what's in the book in his lectures, so attendance is not mandatory if you can read. Gnarly accent,  draws cute doodles, Shiny bald head; Hey, what's not to love?

shouldn't be considered a prof. doesn't teach the course at all, just summarizes the book.  questioned him on MT, admits that i am right but provides "partial" marks although I'm 100% correct. also questioned an assignment and admits to be wrong yet unwilling to change my mark.  TERRIBLE prof. DONT TAKE HIM IN ANY COURSE.

He lacks professionalism and shouldn't be a prof. ALWAYS late and never organized. Nor comprehensible. He basically summarizes the text, but screws that up even. Read your text and don't bother going to lecture, him and his TAs are a joke. He's a prima donna as well, watch for him to "feel sick" and end lecture early when you question him too much

He's a very knowledgeable prof but teaching wise, he can definitely get very confusing. Difficult to understand in his class since he talks pretty fast. Extra reading and studying is definitely needed. The textbook and his slides are the best study material. Going to class isn't that helpful, stay updated with materialand do the practice problems.
She's a kind and approachable professor, but her exams are quite difficult, and the way she structures her questions can be confusing or unclear. Overall, I'd rate her 2.5 out of 5.

She is my favorite professor! I won't say her exams are easy, but if you look through the assignments and practice questions that she uploads, review the lecture materials, and ask her questions during office hours, you will be prepared!
The professor is great, willing to help my grade and give me a chance and is patient, if you study hard she will provide you with good marks.
I've never seen a professor write the wrong answers on exam solutions and then refuse to correct them

Very knowledgeable prof. Lectures draw directly from textbook concepts and readings, with additional *spice* added by Professor Cox. Very easy tests -- if you are well prepared. People who say his lectures are boring are people who have no interest in Economics. David is an awesome lecturer and gives great explanations of macroeconomic concepts. Read textbook and attend lectures.
his exams are fair. If you study the textbook, you should do well. His classes are boring but he makes up for it by giving easy exams.

Notes are hand written and scanned into a 30 page pdf. file but are very thorough and clear so you can essentially teach yourself. Average mark on midterm 55-65%.

Skipped most of his lectures. Boring lectures. Just buy the textbook and use the study guide. Read it and do questions from the study guide. My main issue with Dave was that he didn't scale or curve the class at the end and the class average was a C. Decent prof and class as far as ECON goes.

He's an alright prof. No need for lectures because his notes and examples in class are literally a copy of the textbook. Tests are perfectly fair and easy if you do the study guide and study his notes.

Overall, the material itself is pretty easy to understand, but I would not recommend taking this course if it is not mandatory.

Dave's notes are very thorough with everything you need to know. I actually gave up reading the textbook after the midterm because the textbook is extremely dry and instead just relied solely on the notes and listening to his lectures. He is clearly passionate about economics and taught the material well. He won't inspire or amuse but he's solid.

Going to lectures for this class is not necessary as his notes are a copy of the textbook. Exams were not too difficult. Averages are low but it is not hard to do well if you read the textbook, look over his notes, and do the assignment questions. Not a hard class if you can read a textbook and take your own notes. There is no need for attending lectures.

Super easy class with Cox. No need for going to the lecture. As long as you read the textbook carefully and finish the assignments he assigns before the final exam, it will be an easy A! DON'T READ HIS NOTES! READ TEXTBOOK!
Professor Cox's exams were so easy, anyone who complains about the level of difficulty did not put in any effort because the exams were based solely on his notes.

really boring

Junjie knows his stuff, but he does not know how to teach. He's been approached with questions numerous times but he doesn't know how to teach concepts in an effective way. He shows a lack of understanding for students who don't understand concepts fast.. It was a mistake taking a class with him.
Very boring class, dry material, and he just reads off his slides. Exams were pretty hard, would not take again.

Junjie Liu has a really thick accent that is extremely hard to understand creating a barrier for a student to understand course material. He also relies on his powerpoints a lot when teaching. He would read off the slides and expand on his points minimally. I wish that I could have understood his better to receive a better grade.
I took his econ 103 and econ 105. I really love this professor. His notes are clear and his exams are not so hard because he will give you lots of MC exercises. It's easy to pass and get an A.
greatppt is clear and easy to understand. no textbook require. he is a really nice person!

Great prof, everything is straight forwards and there are no curve balls. Minimal weekly review and tutorial question completion is absolutely enough to get an A. His lectures sometimes get boring and you may stop paying attention but his slides are so amazing that you'll be fine nonetheless. Best prof I've had thus far, highly recommend his class.

Junjie is a great professor and he is always available for extra help. He basically put everything you need to know in the lecture slides, so the textbook is not really necessary. The final and midterms were very similar to the tutorial questions. Even some MCs were copied directly from the practice MCQs. Highly recommend Junjie for 105!
He's a cute prof.  Fun class.  Read his notes and you will pass his exams easily !!!!

Liu gives straightforward lectures. His slides are well corresponded with the textbook and serve as excellent review material. He is approachable and open to provide help. Exams are fair and you can do well if you take the time and effort to review.

Excellent notes, always available online. However, if you want answers to some of the questions in the notes, you will have to attend lectures. The lectures are a bit on the boring side, but the prof is always happy to help. Read the notes before and after class and you should be fine. Good luck!

HEADS UP: He does have an accent, but it's not that bad at all.   He is perhaps the most helpful prof I've had yet. He will answer any / all questions during the lecture, and sticks around for both the break and after lecture to answer any / all questions that have arisen. You will have nearly weekly assignments but they're simple + short!
Really helpful prof . He is clear and the test are not hard and easy to understand. Best prof at SFU.
Good professor
Kind professor ever

He is a nice teacher. Every time I ask him questions, he has the patient to help me. His lectures are well organized. If you do all his exercises, you will be fine in this course.  Anyway, he is the best teacher I have met in SFU so far.
He is a nice teacher. You will get a good grade if you do his exercise. His lectures are well organized. Best teacher ever!!!
He speaks Chinglish with can not be understand by someone, exam is tough and final is really matter. He will deducted 2% from final grade for absent. Tough grader ever.

I would suggest you guys to buy past midterm papers as reference! It was very helpful, because he gave similar questions on the final too! So MAKE SURE you study ALL your midterm papers and the MC practice questions! GOOD LUCK everyone.
Pretty good prof, lecture slides are good enough if you don't want to spend a lot of time with this class. Midterms/Final were fair, class average surprisingly low as per usual

By far the nicest prof i have ever had. His midterms and finals are very hard but also EXTREMELY fair. Attend tutorials even though they are not mandatory because it is the only way you'll do well. He is extremely helpful and his midterms/finals are very similar to the practice ones
Lecture notes are really confused. Exams are totally different from lecture notes or tutorial questions.
very nice prof, his notes are really helpful.

His english skills are fine. Much better than average. His course notes are very thorough, but I'd rather a prof that tries to tie in real life present situations instead of just teaching out of the textbook. Study hard for the midterms and do well because the final is pretty brutal and you'll thank yourself later. The course is curved.

midterms were ok, the final was BRUTAL! i didn't even know why i had to study, because all the answers to the final were basically NOT from the textbook for anywhere! TAs are somewhat helpful. if you find a mistake on mt marking, don't even bother asking for that extra mark, cuz they won't give it even if u're right!
Does not speak English. 1st midterm tough but doable. 2nd midterm and final he went pedal to the metal. Avoid like the plague.

Midterms were fine, but the final was brutal. Marking on the final was rediculously hard and unfair, probably why the average was 50%. Waste of money, I would not take Econ 105 again with this professor.

midterms were okay, but final was brutal! its useless to study for the final because when u look at it, it seems like u don't even need to study for it, since it's so freakin hard! class avg didn't even reach 50%! u basically can skip all his lectures and study at home, cuz he copys everything from the textbook!

An average prof, his midterms were all right but his final was insanely difficult. Averages for both midterms were about 60-70% and the final was around 45%... His notes are basically the same as the text so you could study either one and do fairly well.

The textbook is a great read, it does a good job of explaining the concepts. His lecture notes are basically words taken from the textbook, but his notes do focus on the main points if you don't like studying from the textbook.  I thought midterms were relatively straightforward, too easy that he had to make the final harder (It was very brutal).

Either go over his notes really well, or read the textbook. Notes are short and and direct, but the book will provide you with more information and theory behind the economics- probably comes more handy during the tests. MTs are alright- first one had like 70+% average, Final is very brutal- much harder concepts, need to know EVERYHTING.

I like his lecture notes which clear and easy to understand and same as the textbook.Mt and final will kill you! specially 2 hours to write the final exam with 8 questions each of them have A,B,C parts. As I remembered 3 or 4 ppl left after 30 min of 2hr exam.. i guessed they done or give up..

Tried getting his help early in semester, never emailed me back. Went to all tutorials, did textbook questions and studied like mad, still only barely passed midterms because he throws curveball questions at you. Won't let you clarify questions in the exam, but his poor english cost the class grades on the 2nd midterm because of that. Ridiculous!
Class attendance is absolutely pointless since everything covered in the lecture comes directly from the textbook, even the examples were exactly the same as the ones in the text.

Once you get over his accent, his notes are easy, All notes are written on an overhead, so easy to follow. Hw is straight from the notes. Midterms are fair, final is tough if you dont study, only used the text to study for the final. Great guy

The notes are clear. Do not just rely on the notes, you have to read the textbook too. The midterms are very fair and very straight forward. The final exam was extremely hard. I don't know why people say he's not passionate in teaching, he wishes everyone a good weekend and good luck in studying.

A lot of people have time understanding him because of his accent, but it's not THAT bad. Besides, he writes everything he says on the overhead anyway. Lectures are dry and it is rare to get more insight into economics. Final is brutal and exam questions are weighed disproportionally- imo. If you don't understand him, use the text- it's the same.
His notes are really organized and clear, as long as you read the textbook and his notes, you'll do fine. The Final was brutal though but the midterms are same as his tut questions.
Seriously? His finals were SSOO hard. They had absolutely no relevance to what he said was going to be on the exam.
worst prof i ever had. end of story
good prof, close to his notes and questions on TUTOR OF TA, you will be great in this class. he is a good teacher with great and clear notes
he is a great prof, his exam is very close to your book and assignment. if you want to get good point, you should read the book and his question on tut
He's crystal clear, and extremely nice. His midterms are easy. All you have to do is study his notes and attend class!

Very straightforward Prof. Go to every lecture, do your study questions and refer to ur text book and you will be guranteed a B or better. Theres no better Econ prof in sfu. I mean how often can you learn stuff easily and still get a good mark.

The textbook he uses is very helpful for exams. His notes are right out of the textbook so if you read the short chs. you should do well on the exams. Recommend taking ECON103 prior to 105 with him. Grades are all based on 2MTs = 25% each and one final 50%. Overall, its an easy A-/B if you put in the time to learn the stuff.

I really liked my course with Junjie. He's very concise in his notes and he writes everything he says so you shouldn't miss anything in lecture. The exams were fair and his assignments were helpful. He won't work to get you interested but he will effectively teach you the material.

Junjie is a mediocre professor, with poor and unclear notes. I did all my learning from the textbook, and ended up doing fairly well in the class. His marking scheme is pedagogically limiting (2 midterms, 1 final), but the tutorials are helpful for actually learning the material. While Junjie is not a good professor, he's not necessarily a bad one.

If you read and understand all his notes and the textbook, you will do fine. Definitely helpful to attend tutorials since the TAs give out answers to weekly assignment questions.  Prof needs to improve on his English to make it easier for students to understand him.

If you read and understand everything about his notes and the textbook, you will do ok.  TAs give out answers for weekly questions in tutorials, definitely helpful. However, prof needs to improve his English so all students can understand him clearer.
An average prof. Not too bad, not too good. The bad thing about him is his marking scheme: two midterms 25% each, and one final for 50%
TERRIBLE PROF. he's unclear, terrible at answering questions, his T.A's are useless and he doesn't post ANYTHING. no syllabus, no answers to the tutorial questions and no notes. terrible class, AVOID
Hard to understand, material straight from the book-word for word. Tutorials not mandatory. Grades come from 2 midterms and exam.
Nice prof, easy exams.
He made me love Econ, definitely recommend!!!

The class only had two midterms and a final. His lectures included him looking at the screen and turning around and reading what was on the slides to the class. He did barely any practice problems in class so going to lecture seems like a waste of time. was not very accessible either. Best hope is to do the practice problems. Tests were mostly fair
Good teacher, sometimes hard to understand. Exams are extremely difficult and content oriented, but the class is curved, which balances the grades.

Yeah he has a bit of an accent but you can overcome this! He is extremely helpful if you ask him questions!! He wants his class to be very involved. However, his lectures are super boring! Tests are straight from the book and lecture notes (lecture notes are literally based from the book)! Pay attention and practise the problems and youll do fine!
He cares about the students too much. Lectures are very informative and are clear. Assignments are well related. Exams are fair. He is pretty good.
The professor makes the class easy - practice exams are similar to the real ones. Using Unstuck study alongside the provided resources can really help with exam prep.
Ez class, practice exams are the same as the real ones.

He's a great guy. He sometimes adds a few jokes in his lectures. The 3 hour lectures could be a lot because of how content-heavy this course is. There was also a lot at stake with your entire grade being determined by only 3 exams. Otherwise, he is a good lecturer and explains the concepts pretty well. Just go to lectures and tutorials.

out of all the lower level econ teachers he is the best. lectures were ok (not boring but not super interesting) - maybe because it was 3 hrs. tests were relatively fair and make sure you look at the sample tests. questions are mostly marked 5-10 so if you mess up it can cost you a lot. way easier than econ 105 but you have to remember more.

Took Econ 105 and 355w with him. Very straightforward. His lecture slides and previous midterm/finals will help you a lot. Make sure you practice those and he does give hints if you attend lecture. Nicest dude. Tries to make jokes and it is even funnier when no one laughs!

His exams are incredibly fair, very similar to practice questions. His past exams are your best friend as his tests are heavily based off of them. This class is not hard if you remotely put effort into it. He is a fair and great teacher.

Chapter presentation documents are disorganized, jumping from topic to topic, and then back again. All materials are littered with grammatical mistakes, including exams! Lectures are hard to follow and boring. His accent is hard to understand, and he does not speak slowly. He will go on tangents that start interesting but leave you more confused.

He is the easiest, most relaxed professor in all of ECON 105. All the exams are individual and not cumulative (all the questions are basically similar to the exams examples he gives), highly recommended!

Don't look at the other reviews about students complaining about this teacher. He does a great job teaching the content and all the lectures are recorded. All of his exams are incredibly fair, they are either complete copy and paste from past exams or they are straight from the textbook questions he assigns. If you at least try, its not that hard.
Exam 1 was so easy, Exam 2 was a hell of a grind, too hard, too scary. Especially a lot of questions about the class example, even if you go to listen to the class will not do.

Martin's lectures are difficult to follow and stay engaged in, as he strictly lectures the entire 3 hours. He formats the order of the chapters poorly, making the course very disorganized. Despite the syllabus stating that the exams are not cumulative, he put questions from previous chapters that were already tested on the second midterm.

I barley went to any lectures and mostly just self-learned from the slides however when i did go i loved his lectures, they were very engaging. He has three midterm type tests and no final. Each midterm is based on different chapters. Since this is a content heavy class, i loved that he didn't have a cumulative final at the end. Tests were easy.

Martin is amazing! He talks a lot but it's all good vibes. I never showed up to class..maybe like three times.. but whenever I did, it was always a blast! Take ECON105 with Martin, my Argentinian king

Although he is funny, his lessons are somewhat challenging to understand. I benefited from reading the textbook, but that isn't necessary. The whole course is graded by 3 non-cumulative exams. He gives many sample exams from previous semesters to help study; these are extremely similar to the actual exam.

Martin is super engaging and funny and only tests on concepts he goes over in lectures. He made econ so enjoyable and made me eager to go to the class despite it being 3h long. He loves soccer too, which is a bonus! Explains concepts clearly and motivated me to be a better student.

Martin is one of the funniest cool profs I have ever had.  He really cares about his students and the subject matter and does everything he can to make lectures enjoyable.  The class is extremely test-heavy.  You need to ask questions during lecture and pay attention.  Economics was hard for me but Martin made it enjoyable.

Martin is a nice guy who uses real-world examples to teach his lectures. He's funny, but his lectures were hard for me to follow along as he mumbles a lot and doesn't enunciate his words very well. His slides are based exactly on the textbook, but when I could understand him he taught the material well and was very chill! Would recommend

Martin has interesting lectures where he often makes jokes and relates topics to real world events. Sometimes he can run out of time during lecture but anything he doesn't cover is left out of exams. During my semester there were 3 exams which determines the entire grade so keep that in mind!

Class is entirely test based which could be good or bad. Martin is a great lecturer who actually keeps you engaged with real life examples and jokes. Overall material wasn't too challenging, most things on the exam were straight out of his lecture slides. Class averages were very high leading to a tough grading curve.

Martin is an amazing professor, has engaging and useful lectures. Lecture attendance is recommended to do well as some questions on exams are in the lecture material. However, my biggest gripe is his grading scale which is unfair for the people on the lower end as a D is anything under 66 and a C- is above 66 - 70.

Amazing professor, definitely the best choice for ECON 105 as his lectures are engaging and his exams are fair. Study all the practice materials he gives you, especially past exams and additional practice problems. I got my first A+!
My mark is about 75% for the exams but still got A-. Best prof you'll ever take in his class.

Pretty good prof, gives lots of practice. 
Nothing on the exam is unexpected.
I found that lots of the material on exams was based off class discussions, so its important to go to class, but still not mandatory if u can figure it out yourself
he is one of the best prof for econ. he gives a lot of practice problems and practice exams that help you with the real exam. highly recommended! he is very nice and engaging. take econ 105 with him.

Best economics professor in the department! Although the 3 hour lectures can feel long, he makes them very engaging. His exams are very fair and I believe that if you study all the practice problems and past exams he gives you, you will do well. If you see his name, take ECON 105 with this prof!
His class is not bad but his 3 hour lectures can be soooo boring especially if you have a short attention span.

Martin's class was pretty straightforward, I think he's a solid choice for ECON 105. Just go through lecture slides to understand main concepts, and go over the practice questions he provides over and over again. Exams are very similar to all practice questions and practice exams. Overall, Martin is a great prof and adds humor to his lectures.

Martin is friendly and clearly cares about his students. His exams are very fair and very similar to practice tests, so midterms and finals were a breeze for me. One thing to note is that TAs can sometimes make mistakes in marking, I had to grade appeal both of my midterms. Would 100% love to take any Econ class with Martin again.

Martin is an awesome prof. He is funny and really cares about his students. The exams were very similar to the practice exams so make sure you understand those. There were 2 midterms and 1 final. Overall, take Econ with Martin!

He is a really caring professor, and a fantastic lecturer. Practice exams were similar to midterm content, and tutorial questions were also helpful. If you go to class / tutorial and pay attention you will be ok. If you study a moderate amount, read the book, and do lots of practice you should be able to get an A range. Would recommend to anyone
I enjoy his lecture and honestly he is very nice. He actually gives midterm examples before midterms (same with the finals). If you study hard you can get an A in his class.

Nice guy and you can tell he cares about teaching but his lectures were very dry and boring. The practice exams were NOTHING like the exam so do not use them to study, they dont help. Although nothing is ever assigned from the textbook read it because it will help in exams. Overall, do the questions and make sure you understand the content

He includes a lot of lecture-specific topics in his exams, not so much that you HAVE to show up to lecture, but it's a very good idea that you do. He basically gives out answers to his exams during the lecture, just pay attention! If you ask a question, be prepared to stand there with him for 10 whole minutes as he explains EVERYTHING to you.
I found Martin very difficult to understand due to his thick accent. My TA was really bad too, which didnt help. I found his lectures a bit boring and redundant, but definitely wasnt horrible.

Very passionate about what he teaches, and is a pretty funny guy. Tests are challenging, make sure you're listening in lectures because it helps a lot. Test questions are more similar to the book than what he goes over in class.

He tries his best to crack jokes and cares about what he's teaching. Unless you are really passionate about economics, his lecture can get really dry. Was not really organized for his midterms this sem. ( had a lot of mistakes) He was the goat tho because he recorded his in-person lectures.

Honestly, I had this amazing professor two years ago. Now I am thinking back on how good I had it in his class. He is just the perfect prof, I don't know how to explain it. If you have the chance, please take his class. Sincerely, Jaskaran Sandhu.
Fantastic professor. Highly recommend taking either 103/105 with him. Very kind and knowledgeable. Just listen to his lectures, study a bit, and you should be good.

Martin sanataria is by far the sweetest professor ever he really cares about his students and is super passionate about economics! he does have an accent but you will be able to understand him fine. lectures and tutorials are not mandatory, and your mark is accumulated by 2 midterms 25% each and 1 final 50%.
Very friendly and passionate! Must read the textbook and do all practice questions in order to do well on the exams.

Martin cares a lot about his students and is always there to address concerns or answer questions. His lectures can be a bit boring to follow because he tends to get sidetracked sometimes. Lectures aren't that useful because you can just read his lecture slides which he posts. tests are fair but MC is out of 2 or 3 so one wrong has quite an effect.

has a thick accent but not hard tp understand once you get used to it. he assigns practice questions from the textbook but not for marks. doing his practice questions and reading through the slides is enough to get a solid mark on the exams. has a great personality and customizes stories for the examples to fit the material. great prof.
Best professor Ive had up until now. Every lecture was enjoyable and captivating. Made me actually want to go to class. Would recommend!

Very good prof. Knows first year econ courses can get dry and lots of people don't really care but he tries to make it as engaging as possible. Tests are fairly easy, except that sometimes there are mistakes on the tests which can throw people off. Just go to class and review the lecture notes!

Dr. Santamaria is honestly, simply put, awesome. He cares about his students and almost always will set up individual office hours with you if you shoot him a email. His exams are fair, and his lecture notes line up almost perfectly with his exams. Overall, great professor. Oh, he's also hilarious.
He is one of the most caring professors in SFU. He explains the material really well and the exams are fair. 3 exams in total, 2 midterms (worth 25%) and cumulative final (worth 50%).
One of the best prof at SFU. His lectures are simple, straightforward, and funny. Gives great materials to prepare for exams so the curve can be relatively high. Definitely should take.

My experience is that he knows what he's talking about. Too much review in each class, however. Sometimes goes off topic. Elaborates on topics to the point where clear understanding got mushed. Exams marked on a curve so marks above 80% are going to pass you with a good mark. The majority based off of practice problems. 2 25% midterms, 1 50% final

Very interesting and worthwhile class and prof. Quizzes and exams are challenging, but are doable by explaining thoughts of material from class. TA is helpful. Marks scaled up later. Sit back for half the lecture about random stuff with econ remarks, picking on students, or silly jokes. Being a well paid goalie beats 5 bucks a day plus food coupons

Hard midterms/finals, but I somehow ended up with an okay mark. Marking on tests was weird...marks taken away for weird things. Notes were ok...messy writing though. Lots of theory on the exams, not too much calculations. Very nice proff and funny with good explanations and he repeats stuff a lot so it's easier to learn.
AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME prof... funny, interesting... nuff said.
YOU HAVE TO TRUST ME!!!DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS, you will not get a good mark (even you worked really hard), he is a funny guy, but trust me, if you took his class, drop it IMMEDIATELY!!

this guys wickd! super funny, jus dont sit at the back of the class, exams are tough but go to class, take good notes and u'll do fine.  drops lots of hints for questions and helpful study tips. recommend this guy if your willing to do the work.

Suki is the****! Awesome, funny guy who can give you a dose of real life, rather than just economics. If you come to lectures, study the notes well (mainly the little lists he gives) and pay attention to his hints on what to study for, u'll get an A :D Final=more application, midterm=all theory
Good intentions, enjoyed his class, but very meticulous and scary when it comes to exams.  You better know your stuff.
havent had the final yet but ill agree with the rest, never get what he's writing
I cant read his stupid notes.....had to rely on textbook, class avg was aroun 60% for first midterm, alot of ppl hate this class apparently
awesome prof. very funny, fair exams. the problem is he speaks too fast and in a slur, notes are hard to follow (and also all over the place).

Not a bad teacher... but I did get a bad mark in his class, so who knows? I thought I was just bad at Econ.

i think he is really an ECON teacher... although he doesn't teach as others do(like u have to read the textbook all by yourself),but his points are really reasonable.and exams have almost the some MC questions with his sample!!

Yan Yan is the GOAT! He's the professor I've ever had, he's funny, his lectures are engaging, and he CURVES GREAT! He'll explain/clarify concepts for you, change the weightage of exams if you show improvement, and his exams are fair. Do practice problems (especially long answer) and study sets every week, without fail, and you'll be perfectly fine!

took him for 103, 105 felt much harder material wise. tests focus heavily on application that is based on lots of theory, but his exams are fair if you prioritize doing long-answer questions.

prof is very willing to help you understand topics, goes through lectures at a good pace. his difficulty is fair, but your study habits are important.

Yan is my favorite prof I've had at SFU. 
He is funny and the lectures are engaging, his accent doesn't change the fact he makes ECON easy to understand unlike most profs. If you just read the textbook and do the practice problems you'll be more than ready for the exams. I highly recommend Yan and hope to take classes with him again. e

Yan Yan is by far one of my favorite professors at SFU. Very caring, kind, and helpful outside of class. Midterm and final is not hard if you study the lectures and do the problem sets. His accent is understandable and he's overall just a great professor, would take again 100%. Very funny too lol.

ECON 105 felt a lot harder than 103 tbh, way more abstract and packed with concepts. I did think about dropping at one point. But Yan made the hard stuff feel manageable. He's super encouraging (like actually), which helped way more than I expected. Glad I stuck with it.

Good professor, provided us with problem sets which gave a good insight into what was going to be on the exams. Attending lectures are very optional, there are pop quizzes however. His accent makes it very hard to learn and understand what he's saying.

My favourite professor at SFU so far. He is funny, considerate, and kind but still challenging. His lectures are genuinely helpful and engaging, and gets me excited to learn. Study properly and you will do well. There are participation mark "pop" quizzes worth 20% which grant free 5/10 pts as long as you submit anything at all.

I didn't take any econ in high school, so it's more technical than I thought it'd be. But Yan's really good at breaking it down and making it make sense for us. You can tell he actually cares about his students. It'd be even better if there weren't any quizzes though!
Awesome prof! Even during the boring parts, like calculating GDP, CPI and all that stuff, he knows how to vibe with us and keep things chill.
It's really amazing time to study this course with Prof.Yan!
